snippet.title: Amber Heard and Johnny Depp leave court seperately
snippet.description:
(15 Jul 2020) American model-actress Amber Heard and ex-husband Johnny Depp could be seen separately leaving London's High Court on Wednesday after another day of Depp's libel trial against a British tabloid newspaper that accused him of abusing Heard during their relationship.
Depp is suing News Group Newspapers, publisher of The Sun, and the paper’s executive editor, Dan Wootton, over an April 2018 article that called him a “wife-beater.”
He strongly denies abusing Heard.
Heard, 34, has made 14 allegations of violence by 57-year-old Depp between 2013 and 2016, in settings including his private island in the Bahamas, a rented house in Australia and a private jet.
He denies them all.
During Wednesday's hearings, Heard's former personal assistant claimed that she told the model-actress about a violent sexual assault she had endured, only for Heard to “twist" the story for her own use.
Kate James, who worked for Heard between 2012 and 2015, gave evidence in support of Depp, and said she had told Heard that she was raped at machete-point in Brazil about 25 years ago.
She said she was shocked to learn that in a witness statement, Heard misrepresented and exploited the incident.
“She referred directly to a violent rape that occurred to me 26 years ago and she twisted it into her own story and she used it for her own use," James said by video link from Los Angeles.
Heard is due to give evidence in the case later this week.
